mdRecord.dcterms:title: Kraus House, detail view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "...also known as the Frank Lloyd Wright House in Ebsworth Park, is a house in Kirkwood, Missouri designed by architect Frank Lloyd Wright. The house was designed and constructed for Russell and Ruth Goetz Kraus, and the initial design was conceived in 1950. Construction continued until at least 1960 and was never formally completed. The owners lived in the house for about 40 years (Ruth died in 1992)." -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kraus_House [work]
